post.titolo: The decorative cycle of the foundation of Padua
post.descrizione: The prominent element of the decorations is the painted architectural system of imitation marble pilasters with Ionic capitals, which marks the spaces. This system lends itself to framing four large squares open on the side walls of the longer arms. Luca da Reggio seals the episodes of the Stories of Antenore, the founder of the city of Padua, into the wall. At the base of the paintings there is a continuous plinth of decorated faux marble, which contains some descriptions in Latin that tell the episodes depicted. The choice of the decorative cycle by Benedetto Selvatico cannot be traced in the attachment to the city of Padua, but in the strong cultural bond that the academician had for the classics and the art of erudition. A non-secondary aspect for the choice is given by the fact that the Selvatico family did not boast illustrious descendants or very ancient origins.
